what: Wrangle CCAL Data Into Machine Readable Format
title: Wrangle CCAL Data Into Machine Readable Format
text: goal imdccal extract data water chemistry lab deliverables convert machine readable format.

title: Wrangle CCAL Data Into Machine Readable Format
text: can install development version imdccal GitHub repository :

title: Wrangle CCAL Data Into Machine Readable Format
text: Read data single file CCAL lab data write machine-readable version Excel file set CSV files: Read data multiple files CCAL lab data write machine-readable version Excel files sets CSV files: Read tidy data work R, without writing data files:
code: library(imdccal) # We'll assume that you have the CCAL file and a folder called "ccal_tidy" in your working directory machineReadableCCAL("LVLD_101118.xlsx", destination_folder = "ccal_tidy")  # Write tidied data to a new .xlsx machineReadableCCAL("LVLD_101118.xlsx", format = "csv", destination_folder = "ccal_tidy")  # Write tidied data to a folder of CSV files library(imdccal) # We'll assume that you have a folder full of CCAL files in a folder called "ccal", and a folder called "ccal_tidy" in your working directory all_files <- list.files("ccal", pattern = "*.xlsx$", full.names = TRUE) machineReadableCCAL(all_files, destination_folder = "ccal_tidy")  # Write one file of tidied data per input file machineReadableCCAL(all_files, format = "csv", destination_folder = "ccal_tidy")  # Write one folder of tidied CSV data per input file library(imdccal) all_files <- list.files("ccal", pattern = "*.xlsx$", full.names = TRUE) tidy_ccal <- getCCALData(all_files) lvld_18_data <- tidy_ccal$`LVLD_101118.xlsx`$data  # Get the data for a single set of lab results lvld_18_meta <- tidy_ccal$`LVLD_101118.xlsx`$metadata # Get the metadata for the same set of results

title: Read CCAL Data — getCCALData
text: nested list. list item corresponds one input file contains data frames data metadata.

title: Read CCAL Data — getCCALData
code: if (FALSE) { my_folder <- "ccal_results" file_list <- list.files(my_folder, pattern = "*.xlsx$", full.names = TRUE) all_ccal_data <- getCCALData(file_list) }

what: Wrangle CCAL data into a machine-readable format — machineReadableCCAL
title: Wrangle CCAL data into a machine-readable format — machineReadableCCAL
text: Takes data delivered CCAL, extracts , rewrites tabs xlsx file csv files folder.

title: Wrangle CCAL data into a machine-readable format — machineReadableCCAL
code: machineReadableCCAL(   files,   format = c("xlsx", "csv"),   destination_folder = "./",   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Wrangle CCAL data into a machine-readable format — machineReadableCCAL
text: files Path .xlsx file delivered CCAL. Use character vector specify multiple files. format File format export machine readable data - either "xlsx" "csv" destination_folder Folder save data . Defaults current working directory. Folder must already exist. overwrite Overwrite existing file (Defaults TRUE write.table)

title: Wrangle CCAL data into a machine-readable format — machineReadableCCAL
text: Invisibly returns list containing data written file.

title: Wrangle CCAL data into a machine-readable format — machineReadableCCAL
code: if (FALSE) { ccal_folder <- "ccal_results" dest_folder <- "ccal_results/tidied" file_list <- list.files(my_folder, pattern = "*.xlsx$", full.names = TRUE) machineReadableCCAL(file_list, format = "xlsx", destination_folder = dest_folder) machineReadableCCAL(file_list, format = "csv", destination_folder = dest_folder) }

what: Expand Number Range in Text to All Numbers in Range — rangeToVector
title: Expand Number Range in Text to All Numbers in Range — rangeToVector
text: Takes character vector containing number range (e.g. "11 - 14") replaces range numbers contained range ("11 12 13 14").
